column4: hey guys, can anyone recommend me a book on ubuntu? preferably one that uses lucid for examples? basically, i want to become what some would call a "pro"
at linux. i want to understand all about modding the software im running, all about the different layers of the operating system, i want to be able to handle problems on my own
instead of running off to google every 5 minutes...
Please don't flood, use http://paste.ubuntu.com to paste, don't use Enter as punctuation.
